update.description:
This pull request introduces the Server class and its designed test unit to the default branch. The Server class contains functionality to handle communication between Server and multiple agents using TCP protocol and multithreading architecture.
In order to test the module, a sample agent was implemented in which the agent sends a sample action message to the server. In reply, the server sends back a sample sense message to the agent. The sample action and sense message is given in the format and length of the robocup simulation messages.
update.title: Server class and its test
update.reason: New implementation based on branch `server_caguero` will be submitted.

content.raw: @nima_sh , please leave a comment here when you're done merging things and you think the pull request is ready to be reviewed again.
content.html: @nima_sh , please leave a comment here when you're done merging things and you think the pull request is ready to be reviewed again.

content.raw: @nima_sh , did you have the chance to look into the suggestions?
content.html: @nima_sh , did you have the chance to look into the suggestions?

content.raw: Yes, actually I could send it to clients. the problem was mainly on the test procedure, it has been fixed. I will use this server for the parser :)
content.html: Yes, actually I could send it to clients. the problem was mainly on the test procedure, it has been fixed. I will use this server for the parser :)

content.raw:
For quick and manually testing you can use the `nc` command:

```
#!c++
nc localhost 4101
```

Let me know what is the problem with the `Push()`. You shouldn't have to modify the `Server` class unless there's a bug. We should use `Push()` in the `Server_TEST`.
content.html:
For quick and manually testing you can use the nc command:

nc localhost 4101

Let me know what is the problem with the Push(). You shouldn't have to modify the Server class unless there's a bug. We should use Push() in the Server_TEST.

content.raw: I have already read the codes. Yes, of course , its a very intesting server. I could run several clients on that server and the client id assigned correctly. Still, I could not send message to TCP clients using push method. I am trying to to do this test. I could also send a big s-expression to a client. I think we also need to test server in a conversation with several clients.
content.html: I have already read the codes. Yes, of course , its a very intesting server. I could run several clients on that server and the client id assigned correctly. Still, I could not send message to TCP clients using push method. I am trying to to do this test. I could also send a big s-expression to a client. I think we also need to test server in a conversation with several clients.

content.raw: I finished with the comments, I think the first one is a reported code cheker bug. the other is the messgae that we send , which are too long, I will fix them
content.html: I finished with the comments, I think the first one is a reported code cheker bug. the other is the messgae that we send , which are too long, I will fix them

content.raw:
Could you take over that code? We should update your pull request, add the missing doxygen and probably add another test. For the new test I'm thinking to create a new TCP client that connects to the server. In the thread that creates the server and after calling `server.Start()` we could use `Push` for sending data to the client. We should check on the client that the data was received. 

I think that we'd have a basic server ready to roll. What do you think?
content.html:
Could you take over that code? We should update your pull request, add the missing doxygen and probably add another test. For the new test I'm thinking to create a new TCP client that connects to the server. In the thread that creates the server and after calling server.Start() we could use Push for sending data to the client. We should check on the client that the data was received.

I think that we'd have a basic server ready to roll. What do you think?

content.raw: Yes, defenetly. The code is great with an interesting architecture.
content.html: Yes, defenetly. The code is great with an interesting architecture.

content.raw: @nima_sh Take a look at a branch named `server_caguero` that I wrote inspired by your server. It uses `poll` and uses a single thread. It seems to work although it needs a little bit of care.
content.html: @nima_sh Take a look at a branch named server_caguero that I wrote inspired by your server. It uses poll and uses a single thread. It seems to work although it needs a little bit of care.

content.raw: Intersting, I will check it. I found that, you have also tested it and improved the code.
content.html: Intersting, I will check it. I found that, you have also tested it and improved the code.

content.raw: No, In fact it was needed for prevoiuse implementation of singleton pattern.
content.html: No, In fact it was needed for prevoiuse implementation of singleton pattern.

content.raw: Yes, certainly.
content.html: Yes, certainly.

content.raw: There's a potential race condition here. You should pass the clientNo for the new thread as a parameter.
content.html: There's a potential race condition here. You should pass the clientNo for the new thread as a parameter.

content.raw: Make sure that you only include the headers that you're using in the header file. Do the same thing in `Server.cc`. For example, `#include <thread>` should be in `Server.cc` but not here.
content.html: Make sure that you only include the headers that you're using in the header file. Do the same thing in Server.cc. For example, #include <thread> should be in Server.cc but not here.

content.raw: `while (true)`
content.html: while (true)

content.raw: Use `namespace gazebo {` for declaring the Server class inside the gazebo namespace.
content.html: Use namespace gazebo { for declaring the Server class inside the gazebo namespace.

Move these constants inside Server (before the member variable definitions) in the header file. Use also camelStyle with a k prefix. Better use static const int. E.g.:

  static const int kPortNumber = 3100;
  static const int kBufferSize = 8192;

content.html: Add some doxygen to this method.

content.raw:
@nima_sh, not sure if you finished with the comments, but just in case I already see these errors in the checker:

```
#!c++
caguero@dd9:~/workspace/robocup3ds$ sh tools/code_check.sh 
[include/robocup3ds/Server.hh:34]: (style) struct or union member 'connection_t::sock' is never used.
./src/Server.cc:106:  Lines should very rarely be longer than 100 characters  [whitespace/line_length] [4]
./src/Server_TEST.cc:47:  Lines should very rarely be longer than 100 characters  [whitespace/line_length] [4]
./src/Server_TEST.cc:100:  Lines should very rarely be longer than 100 characters  [whitespace/line_length] [4]
Total errors found: 3
```

@nima_sh, not sure if you finished with the comments, but just in case I already see these errors in the checker:

content.raw:
You can add the new class and test to the previously existing parenthesis. We try to always add them in alphabetic order like this:

~~~
set (sources
  Robocup3dsPlugin.cc
  Server.cc
)

set (gtest_sources
  Robocup3dsPlugin_TEST.cc
  Server_TEST.cc
)
~~~
content.html:
You can add the new class and test to the previously existing parenthesis. We try to always add them in alphabetic order like this:

set (sources
  Robocup3dsPlugin.cc
  Server.cc
)

set (gtest_sources
  Robocup3dsPlugin_TEST.cc
  Server_TEST.cc
)

content.raw: Prefix all input variables with `_`, like `int _sock`
content.html: Prefix all input variables with _, like int _sock

Use 2 space indentation everywhere, for example:

void Server::Start()
{
  int ...
  if (...)
  {
    error ...
  }
}

content.raw:
All pointers `*` and references `&` should be to the right like this:

`Server *GetUniqueInstance()`
content.html:
All pointers * and references & should be to the right like this:

Server *GetUniqueInstance()

content.raw: Add a white line between functions.
content.html: Add a white line between functions.

content.raw: Could you move the `{` to the next line? (Gazebo style).
content.html: Could you move the { to the next line? (Gazebo style).

content.raw: Use `this->` with all member variables and functions` (Gazebo style).
content.html: Use this-> with all member variables and functions` (Gazebo style).

content.raw: `clientCounter++`
content.html: clientCounter++

This is not thread safe. In C++11 you could do:

static Server server;
return &server;

content.raw: Let's follow the same Gazebo style guide, where methods start with uppercase.
content.html: Let's follow the same Gazebo style guide, where methods start with uppercase.

content.raw: Make the constructor private. A server object should only be allocated using `GetUniqueInstance()`
content.html: Make the constructor private. A server object should only be allocated using GetUniqueInstance()

content.raw: Add `public:` or `private:` to all member variables (see Gazebo source code).
content.html: Add public: or private: to all member variables (see Gazebo source code).

content.raw: Add doxygen documentation to each class, member variable and member functions (including parameters). Take a look at the Gazebo source code for examples.
content.html: Add doxygen documentation to each class, member variable and member functions (including parameters). Take a look at the Gazebo source code for examples.
